metadata.title: CVE-2013-6430 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The JavaScriptUtils.javaScriptEscape method inweb/util/JavaScriptUtils.java in Spring MVC in Spring Framework before3.2.2 does not properly escape certain characters, which allows remoteattackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via a (1) lineseparator or (2) paragraph separator Unicode character or (3) left or (4)right angle bracket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6430` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspring-aop-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-11
libspring-beans-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-11
libspring-context-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-11
libspring-context-support-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-11
libspring-core-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-11
libspring-expression-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-11
libspring-instrument-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-11
libspring-jdbc-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-11
libspring-jms-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-11
libspring-orm-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-11
libspring-oxm-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-11
libspring-test-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-11
libspring-transaction-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-11
libspring-web-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-11
libspring-web-portlet-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-11
libspring-web-servlet-java - 3.0.6.RELEASE-11
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libspring-java package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.6.RELEASE-11').
